title: Research Loro's movable tree CRDT for outliner data model
description:
Deep dive into Loro's movable tree implementation to evaluate fit for this project.

Key questions to answer:
1. How does Loro's movable tree handle concurrent move operations?
2. What's the storage format? Can we export human-readable snapshots?
3. How does compaction/garbage collection work?
4. What are the Rust API ergonomics like?
5. How would it integrate with Tauri?
6. Can we layer JSONL archival export on top of Loro's binary format?
7. What's the performance profile for typical outliner operations (10k-100k nodes)?
8. How does it handle the mirror/transclusion use case from our spec?

References:
- https://github.com/loro-dev/loro
- architecture-data-format.md (CRDT section)
- dynalist-replacement-features.md (feature requirements)

comments.author: andy
comments.text:
Completed deep-dive research on Loro CRDT for outliner data model. Created comprehensive evaluation document: research/loro-crdt-evaluation.md

Key findings:
1. Movable tree CRDT is a strong fit - handles concurrent moves via Kleppmann algorithm with undo-replay
2. Performance is good for 10k-100k nodes (205ms for 1M moves on 100K nodes, 39MB memory)
3. Export supports human-readable JSON via toJSON(), can layer JSONL archival on top of binary format
4. Rust API is clean and idiomatic, integrates well with Tauri
5. Main gap: mirrors/transclusion need application-layer implementation (tree CRDT enforces single-parent)
6. Shallow snapshots provide compaction; no automatic GC needed for single-user

Recommendation: Strong candidate. Proceed with proof-of-concept integration.

description: Ctrl+Enter marks the current item as complete. Completion applies to any item regardless of whether it has a checkbox - it's a node-level property. Need to define visual treatment for completed items (strikethrough? dimmed? both?).

title: Add Shift+Up/Down to reorder outline items
description: Shift+Up and Shift+Down should move elements up and down in the outline order. Movement should be based on the position of the shallowest node selected (swap with sibling above/below).

title: Add View menu toggle to show/hide completed items
description: Add toggle in View menu to show or hide completed items. When hidden, completed items (and possibly their children?) are filtered from view. Persist preference. Related to otl-un4 completion feature.

title: Add Ctrl+mousewheel for zoom
description: Ctrl+mousewheel up to zoom in, Ctrl+mousewheel down to zoom out. Complements keyboard zoom shortcuts (otl-9nd). Standard browser-like zoom behavior.

title: Add URL styling and clickable links in content
description: Style URLs in content with link formatting and make them clickable/openable. Similar to how wiki-links work, detect URL patterns and render them as interactive links.

title: Wire up toolbar search box to FTS5 search backend
description: Connect the search box in the toolbar to the existing search Tauri command. Backend already has SQLite FTS5 search via search(query, docId?, limit?). Need to: capture input from search box, call search command, display results (likely as a dropdown/popover), and navigate to selected result.

title: Wiki-style cross-linking with [[ trigger and inline search
description: Implement wiki-style cross-linking: typing '[[' triggers an inline search popup to find items (same or different document). Selected item creates a link stored by UUID. Renders as [item name] but navigates to the linked node. Backend already has get_backlinks(nodeId) for reverse lookups. WikiLink.ts TipTap extension exists as starting point. Needs: inline search UI on '[[', node selection, link storage with UUID, rendered link component, navigation on click.

title: 1.3 Connect Svelte UI to Rust backend
description:
Wire up the existing Svelte outliner UI to load/save via Tauri commands.

Acceptance criteria:
- Load document state from Rust on startup
- Convert between Rust Node format and Svelte OutlineState format
- Each edit operation calls save_op Tauri command
- UI reflects data from Rust layer

title: Implement standard app chrome: menu bar, icon toolbar, status line
description:
Establish the standard desktop app layout structure:

**Row 1 - Menu Bar**
- Standard menus: File, Edit, View, etc.
- Native-feeling menu system

**Row 2 - Icon Toolbar**
- Action icons/buttons
- Search field on far right

**Row 3 - Outline Area**
- Main content area (flex-grow, scrollable)
- Takes remaining vertical space

**Row 4 - Status Line**
- Bottom status bar
- Show contextual info (item count, sync status, etc.)

This defines the core app chrome structure. Related to otl-3f9 (scroll fix).

title: 3.3 Add sync folder configuration UI
description: Add settings/config panel to select sync folder and show sync status. Integrate sync.ts with document operations.

title: Add periodic check for external sync changes
description: Poll for external changes (from Dropbox/Syncthing) every few seconds using check_for_changes(). If changes detected, reload the document and merge with in-memory state. This enables seamless multi-machine editing.

title: Shift+Tab navigates back instead of outdenting
description: Shift+Tab should outdent the current node, but instead it navigates back to the previous item. Tab for indent works correctly.

title: Tauri 2 detection was broken - data not persisting
description: Fixed in 2d0d339. Tauri 2 uses __TAURI_INTERNALS__ instead of __TAURI__ for the global object. This caused the frontend to fall back to mock mode, losing all data on reload.

title: Mirrors (Transclusion)
description:
Workflowy-style mirrors/transclusion.

Subtasks:
- ((( trigger syntax to create mirror
- mirror_source_id field on nodes
- Sync content between mirror and source
- Mirror lifecycle (delete mirror vs source behavior)
